content:
• Thursday, December 1, 2011
  • ZUMZ

    Zumiez (NASDAQ:ZUMZ) shares jump 12.3% after-hours as the retailers Q3 results easily beat...

    Zumiez (NASDAQ:ZUMZ) shares jump 12.3% after-hours as the retailers Q3 results easily beat estimates. Earnings jumped 15% as same-store sales continue to climb. Additionally, the company posted same-store sales growth of 8.4% - on top of a 20.7% increase a year earlier - which easily topped Street estimates for a 2.7% gain.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:39 PM
  • AVGO

    More on Avago Technologies (NASDAQ:AVGO): FQ4 beats estimates on a rise in overall revenue, but...

    More on Avago Technologies (NASDAQ:AVGO): FQ4 beats estimates on a rise in overall revenue, but earnings fell 6.1% Y/Y as the semiconductor designer racked up higher expenses and lower industrial sales. The company also guides FQ1 revenue below expectations, now expecting revenue to be down sequentially between 10% - 14% to a range of $560M - $536M, below Street estimates of $594M. Shares -2.7% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:26 PM
  • HRB

    More on H&R Block (NYSE:HRB): FQ2 misses EPS estimates as its loss widens - despite higher...

    More on H&R Block (NYSE:HRB): FQ2 misses EPS estimates as its loss widens - despite higher net revenue - on a jump in overhead costs. The company is at the tail end of a revamp to return its focus back on its traditional tax-preparation business, including divesting itself of its brokerage and sagging mortgage-lending operations. Shares -2.7% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:12 PM
  • ULTA

    Ulta Salon (NASDAQ:ULTA) Q3 beats on a per share basis but comes up short on revenue. Profit...

    Ulta Salon (NASDAQ:ULTA) Q3 beats on a per share basis but comes up short on revenue. Profit jumped 22% Y/Y, with a steady increase in same-store sales, but its revenue outlook failed to exceed expectations like it did in the first half. The company now expects Q4 sales to come in between $552M - $562M, towards the lower end of estimates. Shares -1% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 6:57 PM
  • SINA

    Sina (NASDAQ:SINA) gains 2.8% AH after Deutsche upgrades shares to Buy, and lifts its PT to...

    Sina (NASDAQ:SINA) gains 2.8% AH after Deutsche upgrades shares to Buy, and lifts its PT to $94.80. The firm is bullish on both Sina's social gaming efforts - unlike rivals Tencent (OTCPK:TCEHY) and Renren (NYSE:RENN), Sina doesn't compete with its developer partners - and its ability to monetize its fast-growing Weibo microblogging platform.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:10 PM
  • LPHI

    Life Partners Holdings (NASDAQ:LPHI) finishes the day +6% after it confirms that it's returned...

    Life Partners Holdings (NASDAQ:LPHI) finishes the day +6% after it confirms that it's returned to compliance with Nasdaq listing rules.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:23 PM
  • FSII

    FSI International (NASDAQ:FSII) finishes with +14.2% gain after saying it's received a follow-on...

    FSI International (NASDAQ:FSII) finishes with +14.2% gain after saying it's received a follow-on order for its ORION Single Wafer Cleaning System from two leading semiconductor producers.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:12 PM
  • TXI

    Texas Industries (TXI +8.8%) finishes sharply higher after it moves to block a hostile takeover...

    Texas Industries (TXI +8.8%) finishes sharply higher after it moves to block a hostile takeover effort by terminating an agreement with one of its largest shareholders, privately owned investment group NNS Holding and Nassef Sawiris.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:01 PM
  • HPQ

    Hewlett-Packard (HPQ +1.3%) is upgraded at Pacific Crest, which asserts that the risk/reward in...

    Hewlett-Packard (HPQ +1.3%) is upgraded at Pacific Crest, which asserts that the risk/reward in the stock is now in balance after big Street estimate cuts. H-P still enjoys a central role in IT, based on a CIO survey showing 49% plan to increase spending on HP’s wares in 2012 as a percentage of their budgets. Plus, there's faith in Meg Whitman's turnaround ability.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:46 PM | 1 Comment
  • SHLDQ

    Sears (SHLD -5%) dips lower after it says it will hold a special sale Friday and Saturday...

    Sears (SHLD -5%) dips lower after it says it will hold a special sale Friday and Saturday offering steep discounts on some of its popular categories as the retailer attempts to lure holiday shoppers. Some of the deals it's going to offer will be even better than its Black Friday discounts.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:46 PM
  • BB

    Research In Motion (RIMM +4.1%) is rallying on another round of buyout buzz. Caitlin Duffy notes...

    Research In Motion (RIMM +4.1%) is rallying on another round of buyout buzz. Caitlin Duffy notes options speculators are placing big bets on December calls - some of which expire tomorrow. Nomura's Rick Sherlund, however, is throwing cold water on the sometimes-discussed notion that Microsoft (NASDAQ:MSFT) might be interested in RIM, and Eric Savitz is even more skeptical of such a tie-up occurring. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:33 PM
  • AUO

    LCD panel maker AU Optronics (AUO +5%) is up strongly for the second straight day. Today's move...

    LCD panel maker AU Optronics (AUO +5%) is up strongly for the second straight day. Today's move could be the result of positive comments from Chairman K.Y. Lee, who thinks prices for certain TV panels will bottom out soon, and that strong holiday sales could lead some TV makers to speed up their 2012 product launches. Weak panel pricing has taken a toll on AU Optronics' shares this year.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:15 PM
  • GMCR

    A little bit more on Green Mountain Coffee's (GMCR +2.8%) upgrade from Blair (previous): Analyst...

    A little bit more on Green Mountain Coffee's (GMCR +2.8%) upgrade from Blair (previous): Analyst Jon Anderson writes that the residential coffee market continues to trend toward single serve and end demand for Keurig brewers and K-Cup portion packs is strong. The WSJ's Matt Phillips takes a look at the GMCR landscape and notes that the consensus price target of analysts - sans David Einhorn - on shares is $96.56, about 79% over its current trading price.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:07 PM
  • SCMR

    Sycamore Networks (SCMR -4.9%) does a rapid about-face after posting a 4% gain at the open on a...

    Sycamore Networks (SCMR -4.9%) does a rapid about-face after posting a 4% gain at the open on a surge in revenues, but the shares soon slumped on apparent investor fatigue as its FQ1 loss brings its streak up to five consecutive quarters. There are signs of improvement however, as revenues leapt 31.6% Y/Y, and gross margin jumped to 59.3% from 41.2%.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:05 PM
  • CF

    After failing to participate in yesterday's rally, CF Industries (CF +5.7%) is today's top...

    After failing to participate in yesterday's rally, CF Industries (CF +5.7%) is today's top S&P gainer as Ticonderoga calls the stock a buying opportunity. A European-based crop nutrients research firm predicted mid-term fertilizer price weakness, but Ticonderoga views it as more a macro top-down call on European economic uncertainty than a bottoms-up call on the ag sector (Briefing.com).

     
     
     
     
    | 2:59 PM
  • AGN

    Allergan (AGN +0.8%) gets a boost from an upgrade to Buy at Argus on valuation, citing its...

    Allergan (AGN +0.8%) gets a boost from an upgrade to Buy at Argus on valuation, citing its strong growth prospects.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:04 PM
  • MDT

    Covidien (COV +2.2%) trades higher after announcing the FDA has issued a clearance for the...

    Covidien (COV +2.2%) trades higher after announcing the FDA has issued a clearance for the company's SpiderFX, an embolic protection device for the treatment of severely calcified arterial lesions in the lower extremities.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:55 PM
  • SMTC

    Semtech (SMTC +2.4%) gains despite posting weak guidance yesterday, as Oppenheimer defends the...

    Semtech (SMTC +2.4%) gains despite posting weak guidance yesterday, as Oppenheimer defends the shares, saying it should be bought on weakness. Separately, Caris also raises its rating to Above Average and ups its price target to $28.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:49 PM
  • AEO

    Bad news for Cotton, good news for retailers? A deadly combination of a record global crop and...

    Bad news for Cotton, good news for retailers? A deadly combination of a record global crop and falling consumption will continue to pound cotton prices and keep sentiment bearish in the trading pits, according to analysts. Standing to benefit are manufacturers and retailers: Levi-Strauss is cutting back prices to reign in price-conscious shoppers, while American Eagle Outfitters' (AEO +0.4%) CEOÂ highlighted the importance of the commodity to his firm's bottom line in an earnings CC.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:39 PM | 2 Comments
  • ROST

    Ross Stores (ROST +3.8%) gains on a better-than-expected same-store sales report. November...

    Ross Stores (ROST +3.8%) gains on a better-than-expected same-store sales report. November same-store sales rose 5%, beating analysts expectations of 3.7%. Total sales jumped 10% to $765M, and the company continues to project December same-store sales to rise between 3% - 4%.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:33 PM
  • NTES

    NetEase.com (NTES +2.3%) moves up after announcing a $50M stock buyback to be executed over the...

    NetEase.com (NTES +2.3%) moves up after announcing a $50M stock buyback to be executed over the next three months.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:23 PM
  • WNR

    Western Refining (WNR +7%) pops after announcing it's selling its idled Yorktown, Virginia...

    Western Refining (WNR +7%) pops after announcing it's selling its idled Yorktown, Virginia refinery, plus an underutilized segment of its crude oil pipeline in southeast New Mexico, to subsidiaries of Plains All American Pipeline (PAA +1.4%) for $220M.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:09 PM
  • JWN

    Nordstrom (JWN +3.4%) ticks higher after its same-store sales beat expectations earlier today....

    Nordstrom (JWN +3.4%) ticks higher after its same-store sales beat expectations earlier today. November same store sales grew 5.6% year-over-year, while preliminary total retail sales increased 11.6% to $910M from the year-ago period's $815M.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:57 PM
  • FIO

    Fusion-io (FIO -9.2%) struggles ahead of a series of share lock-up expirations. Nearly 9M shares...

    Fusion-io (FIO -9.2%) struggles ahead of a series of share lock-up expirations. Nearly 9M shares will be eligible for sale on Dec. 6, 12M on Dec. 19, and 43M on Feb 12. (S-1) (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:51 PM
  • AMZN

    That little spike down from $198 to $195 in Amazon (NASDAQ:AMZN) a few minutes ago? Benzinga -...

    That little spike down from $198 to $195 in Amazon (NASDAQ:AMZN) a few minutes ago? Benzinga - citing the WSJ - says Google (NASDAQ:GOOG) is working on a same-day delivery system for online purchases, and is speaking to retailers about the design. AMZN shares are now at $196.15, +2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:40 PM
  • SPB

    Spectrum Brands Holdings (SPB -2.7%) trades lower after SunTrust cuts the shares to Neutral,...

    Spectrum Brands Holdings (SPB -2.7%) trades lower after SunTrust cuts the shares to Neutral, citing limited near-term catalysts.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:31 PM
  • OZK

    Bank of the Ozarks (OZRK -3.5%) dips after Wunderlich cuts the shares to Hold from Buy on valuation.

    Bank of the Ozarks (OZRK -3.5%) dips after Wunderlich cuts the shares to Hold from Buy on valuation.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:27 PM
  • FMS

    Fresenius Medical (FMS +1.3%) gets a boost from a valuation upgrade by Morgan Stanley to...

    Fresenius Medical (FMS +1.3%) gets a boost from a valuation upgrade by Morgan Stanley to Overweight from Equal Weight.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:00 PM
  • FXF

    The greenback and the euro quickly surge higher vs. the Swiss franc on a rumor the SNB is...

    The greenback and the euro quickly surge higher vs. the Swiss franc on a rumor the SNB is considering additional weakening steps, including the imposition of negative interest rates. FXF -0.3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:49 AM
  • KKD

    Krispy Kreme (KKD -5.3%) is selling off post-earnings, as investors pay more attention to its...

    Krispy Kreme (KKD -5.3%) is selling off post-earnings, as investors pay more attention to its FQ3 revenue miss than its solid EPS guidance. The company suggests price hikes enacted in response to rising commodity costs may be hurting sales. BGB Securities (Hold) is optimistic regarding the uptake for Krispy Kreme's new coffee products, but thinks they'll have a limited impact on results.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:42 AM
  • PLOW

    Snow plow manufacturer Douglas Dynamics (PLOW -4.8%) dips after pricing its secondary offering...

    Snow plow manufacturer Douglas Dynamics (PLOW -4.8%) dips after pricing its secondary offering of around 2M shares at $14.75 per share, a 4.8% discount to yesterday's close. The placement was offered by several large shareholders, including affiliates of Aurora Capital Group.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:39 AM
  • OCZ

    OCZ Technology (OCZ +6.3%) shares sizzle after the solid-state driver maker pre-announces...

    OCZÂ Technology (OCZ +6.3%) shares sizzle after the solid-state driver maker pre-announces FQ3 revenue of $100M-$105M vs. $89.4M consensus, and issues upside guidance for FY2012. "We expect to report record revenue in Q3, driven primarily by increased traction for our enterprise and server SSD offerings," CEOÂ Ryan Petersen says.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:37 AM
  • BKS

    As Barnes & Noble (BKS -19.2%) crashes on account of weak FQ2 results and FY12 guidance,...

    As Barnes & Noble (BKS -19.2%) crashes on account of weak FQ2 results and FY12 guidance, Best Buy provides another piece of discouraging data for the company: the Nook Tablet is only the 8th-best-selling tablet on Best Buy's site, 7 spots below the top-ranked Kindle Fire (NASDAQ:AMZN). The iPad (NASDAQ:AAPL) is likely the most popular tablet overall, given that over a dozen models are listed.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:29 AM
  • HEP

    Holly Energy Partners (HEP -4.3%), a pipeline subsidiary of HollyFrontier (HFC +1%), dips after...

    Holly Energy Partners (HEP -4.3%), a pipeline subsidiary of HollyFrontier (HFC +1%), dips after pricing its secondary offering of 1.5 million common units at $53.50, a 4% discount to yesterday's close. The company plans use the proceeds to pay a portion of the principal of two promissory notes issued to other HollyFrontier units.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:57 AM
  • LZB

    Shares of La-Z-Boy (LZB +16.7%) soar after releasing a mixed FQ2 report. Investors seem to be...

    Shares of La-Z-Boy (LZB +16.7%) soar after releasing a mixed FQ2 report. Investors seem to be homing in on the better-than-expected profits and solid 9.2% increase in same-store sales for the quarter the firm highlighted along with a positive spin for FQ3.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:52 AM
  • STNG

    Scorpio Tankers (STNG -20.1%) gets stung after pricing its secondary offering of 7M shares at...

    Scorpio Tankers (STNG -20.1%) gets stung after pricing its secondary offering of 7M shares at $5.50 per share, a whopping 17% discount to yesterday's closing price. The shipper plans to use the proceeds to buy two tankers and pay down debt. This would be the company's second offering this year, and with just 32 million shares outstanding, dilutes its total shares outstanding by 22%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:51 AM
  • DWA

    Dreamworks (DWA -3.3%) shares are lowered at Caris on concerns around the filmmaker's...

    Dreamworks (DWA -3.3%) shares are lowered at Caris on concerns around the filmmaker's distribution dilemma, for either a renewed distribution deal with Viacom once that deal terminates, nor prospects for a deal with an alternate distributor such as Warner Brothers. The so-so showing thus far of Puss 'n Boots is not a concern, Caris says.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:49 AM
  • MOV

    Movado (MOV +14.8%) is rallying once again thanks to a strong earnings report (previously). The...

    Movado (MOV +14.8%) is rallying once again thanks to a strong earnings report (previously). The watchmaker posted FQ3 revenue of $142.6M (+16% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.65, blowing past Street estimates by $9.2M andÂ  $0.22. Gross margin rose 300 bps Q/Q to 56.8%. Movado now expects FQ4 EPS of $0.93-$0.98, well above its prior guidance range of $0.60-$0.65.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:49 AM
  • TLB

    Talbots (TLB -5.5%) dips after its Q3 beat on revenue but misses on a per share basis due to...

    Talbots (TLB -5.5%) dips after its Q3 beat on revenue but misses on a per share basis due to steep markdowns. Profit decreased 6.6% Y/Y on top of a year-earlier decline of 3.2%. November same-store sales dropped 4%, leading the company to cut guidance for Q4. Additionally, the company says it will be cutting 9% of its staff and closing 110 stores by 2013 in an attempt to reduce costs by around $50M per year.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:38 AM
  • FNSR

    Finisar (FNSR -7.5%) is tumbling after posting its FQ2 report. While EPS beat estimates, the...

    Finisar (FNSR -7.5%) is tumbling after posting its FQ2 report. While EPS beat estimates, the company is guiding for FQ3 revenue of $235M-$250M and EPS of $0.20-$0.24, largely below a consensus of $249.9M and $0.26. Other optical component names are falling in sympathy: OCLR -4.5%. OPLK -2%. NPTN -2.3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:33 AM | 1 Comment
  • BKS

    Shares of Barnes & Noble (BKS -12.5%) get hammered in early trading after the firm misses...

    Shares of Barnes & Noble (BKS -12.5%) get hammered in early trading after the firm misses consensus EPS estimates badly and says it expects full-year earnings to fall in the lower end of its previously issued guidance. The company says it will increase its spend on marketing and advertising for its Nook business - cutting into margins already razor-thin with rival Amazon (AMZN +2.2%) willing to sell e-readers at a loss (I, II).

     
     
     
     
    | 10:27 AM
  • AAL

    US Airways (LCC +10.2%) flying high as Barclays Capital upgrades the carrier to overweight from...

    US Airways (LCC +10.2%) flying high as Barclays Capital upgrades the carrier to overweight from equal weight, saying it is best positioned to benefit from planned domestic capacity cuts. In addition, shares are down 54% from a year ago and so provide an attractive upside.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:24 AM
  • JVA

    Coffee Holding Co. (NASDAQ:JVA), a favorite of both short-sellers and coffee speculators, is up...

    Coffee Holding Co. (NASDAQ:JVA), a favorite of both short-sellers and coffee speculators, is up 7.4% after announcing it's investing $2M to obtain a 40% stake in an instant coffee venture called Global Mark. The company claims sourcing instant coffee from Global Mark will lower its annual costs by 10%. Green Mountain Coffee (GMCR +5.2%) is also rallying, thanks to an upgrade to Outperform from William Blair.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:19 AM | 1 Comment
  • GIL

    The plunge in Gildan Activewear (GIL -28.8%) shares accelerates, after the clothing maker's...

    The plunge in Gildan Activewear (GIL -28.8%) shares accelerates, after the clothing maker's warning of an FQ1 loss of $0.40/share due to high cotton prices and anticipated lower activewear sales volumes on top of its FQ4 15% profit drop. Shares of rival Hanesbrands (HBI -5%) also slide.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:16 AM
  • S

    Clearwire (CLWR +32%) resumes trading sharply higher after being halted following news of...

    ClearwireÂ (CLWR +32%) resumes trading sharply higher after being halted following news of its funding agreement with Sprint (S -1.8%).

     
     
     
     
    | 10:00 AM | 1 Comment
  • AGO

    Shares of Assured Guaranty (AGO +14.4%) surge even as S&P lowers its credit rating two...

    Shares of Assured Guaranty (AGO +14.4%) surge even as S&P lowers its credit rating two notches with a stable outlook, indicating it does not plan to revisit the rating for two years unless the company's capital position changes significantly. The potential for ratings changes on the company has been an impediment to new business.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:39 AM
  • S

    Sprint (S -3%) has offered Clearwire (CLWR +3.4%) up to $1.6B in conditional revenues and...

    Sprint (S -3%) has offered Clearwire (CLWR +3.4%) up to $1.6B in conditional revenues and funding, confirming the report that was floated just before the close of trade yesterday. This clears the way for Clearwire to make a $237M interest payment today. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:27 AM
  • ASNA

    Charming Shoppes (NASDAQ:CHRS) gains 12.1% after using its FQ3 report to announce it's...

    Charming Shoppes (NASDAQ:CHRS) gains 12.1% after using its FQ3 report to announce it's conducting a "comprehensive strategic review," and has hired Barclays to assist in the process. Shares would likely be heading in the opposite direction otherwise - FQ3 revenue of $429.7M (-7% Y/Y) and EPS of -$0.08 missed by $16M and $0.01.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:27 AM
  • PRTK

    Shares of Transcept Pharmaceuticals (TSPT) soar in premarket trading, up 15.5%, after the firm...

    Shares of Transcept Pharmaceuticals (TSPT) soar in premarket trading, up 15.5%, after the firm announces privately-held Purdue exercised its option to commercialize Intermezzo in the U.S. with a Q2 launch planned. Purdue will kick in $100M to support sales and marketing of the sleeping disorder treatment during its first year on the market.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:07 AM
  • LULU

    Lululemon (LULU -13.7%) plunges premarket as it beats earnings, but a revenue miss combined with...

    Lululemon (LULU -13.7%) plunges premarket as it beats earnings, but a revenue miss combined with weaker-than-expected sales guidance of $327-$332M for Q4 suggests the company will have to take a hit on margins to keep growth going.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:06 AM
  • AABA

    Yahoo (YHOO) +4.4% premarket after last night's report that an Alibaba-led group may take a 20%...

    Yahoo (YHOO) +4.4% premarket after last night's report that an Alibaba-led group may take a 20% stake in the firm. But Kara Swisher reports that sources tell her there is no bid in the making. An Alibaba spokesman says flatly: "Alibaba Group has not made a decision to be part of a whole-company bid for Yahoo."

     
     
     
     
    | 9:02 AM
  • LAVA

    Premarket gainers: LAVA +25%. TSPT +17%. AMR +12%. AGO +11%. YHOO +4%. LCC +5%. GMCR +3%. CLWR...

    Premarket gainers: LAVA +25%. TSPT +17%. AMR +12%. AGO +11%. YHOO +4%. LCC +5%. GMCR +3%. CLWR +3%. ALU +3%. SPIL +3%. OPK +3%.
    Losers: STNG -19%. LULU -13%. KSS -7%. IRE -5%. JASO -5%. BCS -3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:00 AM
  • KSS

    Kohl's (NYSE:KSS) is down 7.4%, and J.C. Penney (NYSE:JCP) down 1.2%, after reporting weak...

    Kohl's (NYSE:KSS) is down 7.4%, and J.C. Penney (NYSE:JCP) down 1.2%, after reporting weak November same-store sales. While calling its November results "disappointing," Kohl's says it was "encouraged" by its Thanksgiving weekend performance. However, no figures are provided for weekend sales.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:59 AM | 1 Comment
  • T

    AT&T (NYSE:T) and Deutsche Tel (OTCQX:DTEGY) have not given up on the U.S. carrier buying...

    AT&T (NYSE:T) and Deutsche Tel (OTCQX:DTEGY) have not given up on the U.S. carrier buying T-Mobile USA, and, contrary to a WSJ report, are not in talks about a network-sharing alternative, sources say. If the merger was to win approval, DT has told AT&T it could provide "a few billion dollars" of financing for a buyer of any related divestitures.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:55 AM
  • KR

    Kroger (NYSE:KR): Q3 EPS of $0.33 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $20.6B (+10.3% Y/Y) beats by $190M....

    Kroger (NYSE:KR): Q3 EPS of $0.33 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $20.6B (+10.3% Y/Y) beats by $190M. Raises FY11 EPS guidance to $1.95-2.00 from an earlier $1.85-1.95. Shares +2.9% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:50 AM
  • TGT

    Though Target (NYSE:TGT) CEO Gregg Steinhafel says Nov. sales came in at the low end of...

    Though Target (NYSE:TGT) CEO Gregg Steinhafel says Nov. sales came in at the low end of expectations against a tough comparable, he says the firm is keeping its view for December the same. The merchandising retailer cruised through Black Friday without any reported hitches after an online petition and misbehaving website caught attention. Shares of TGT -2.8% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:34 AM
  • LAVA

    A law firm announces it's investigating the proposed merger of Magma Design (NASDAQ:LAVA) and...

    A law firm announces it's investigating the proposed merger of Magma Design (NASDAQ:LAVA) and Synopsys (NASDAQ:SNPS) to determine if the board undertook a "fair process to obtain maximum value and adequately compensate shareholders." A release from the firm notes three analysts have higher price targets than the agreed $7.35/share offer price. Shares of LAVA, undeterred by the legal threat, trade 25.2% higher premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:24 AM
  • GIL

    More on Gildan Activewear's (NYSE:GIL) FQ4 report: Weak U.S. distributor shipments are blamed...

    More on Gildan Activewear's (NYSE:GIL) FQ4 report: Weak U.S. distributor shipments are blamed for the FQ4 revenue shortfall. Citing weak selling prices and "excess producer inventories," the company expects FQ1 revenue of just $300M and EPS of -$0.40 in FQ1 2012, well below a consensus of $451.1M and $0.29. GIL -10.1% premarket. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 7:46 AM
  • LULU

    Lululemon (NASDAQ:LULU): Q3 EPS of $0.27 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $230.2M (+30.9% Y/Y) misses...

    Lululemon (NASDAQ:LULU): Q3 EPS of $0.27 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $230.2M (+30.9% Y/Y) misses by $5M. Sees Q4 revenue of $327-332M and EPS of $0.40-0.42. Shares -4.9% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 7:35 AM
